TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesday: Slow News Day II

Articles.Content:
> 
> He said it was in the previous statement, which means it can't be in that first sentence,

Oh, so I am way off, read it as the last post ... time to go to bed, you people figure it out, you got seven hours! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> If his "previous statement" is this: "heh, I thought my **ears** were **burning**." Then it's probably sound or heat related.
> [...] That "green lighted" is interesting, as is "but I'm pretty pleased with where it **landed**".

"green lighted" yes, I've seen some requests for different kinds of lights, and that would definitely be a small feature, if the guess was correct. I also noticed the choice of the word "landed" but as Porkjet is the "flying/landing" guy, couldn't come up anything. A sound *overhaul* is not likely, HarvesteR wrote in a previous devnote that he was [looking forward to the audio tools in Unity 5](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/122159-Devnote-Tuesday-Back-to-Work%21?p=1955099&viewfull=1#post1955099). Adding a few FX to ISRU parts would be nice, but I don't think he would describe 'a ton of personal playtesting' in connection with a few sound FX.
I definitely think its landing approximation because if it were some kind of heat improvement, he probably would not have spent a ton of time playtesting it.
How about the phrase " green lighted"?
GregroxMun, Moho heat was in 1.0 my friend. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Landing approximation? Like the Trajectories mod? Not sure that Squad would green light that. I mean, maybe, but I have doubts.

> 
> Landing approximation? Like the Trajectories mod? Not sure that Squad would green light that. I mean, maybe, but I have doubts.

If "landing" was the hint, as opposed to it being a heat thing, my guess would be a biome map for the resource overlay system RoverDude implemented for 1.0.

It connects with his previous work, and is something else the game really needs at present.

it couldn't be a life support, could it?

because that's something missing in the stock game, where players are quite cruelly to their astronauts, letting them starve for years and decades (or even eternity).

> 
> If "landing" was the hint, as opposed to it being a heat thing, my guess would be a biome map for the resource overlay system RoverDude implemented for 1.0.
> It connects with his previous work, and is something else the game really needs at present.

That already exists. It's in the cheat menu.

My guess is resource transfer pipes because he had been **tinkering** with it. Something you would tinker with on EVA would be pipes, I guess?

It also **connects** with his previous work.

Please let it be pipes PLEASEPLEASEPLEASE

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-10T12:52:46Z" title="06/10/2015 12:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 10, 2015</time> by Veeltch**
Is 1.0.3 going to be compatible with the current game? I'd hate to lose my save just as I start branching out toward Jool ...

> 
> That already exists. It's in the cheat menu.

Implemented just as a cheat, not an actual game feature, and in a very basic form without any associated bells or whistles such as visual or sound effects. It can be given an in-game interface, and for example, be used to display biomes where the player has collected science or not with various experiments and such.

I just implemented a similar system for my mod recently, and it makes a big difference to overall playability. It also helps a heck of a lot with picking landing sites, which is why I associated it to that potential hint.

> 
> How about the phrase " green lighted"?

It just means exaxctly that, that it was okay'd.

Also, landing approximation would be more a MechJeb thing, and it already does that actually.

Huge expectations should probably be rained in. They said it was a small giveaway as thanks for waiting, so toss out any ideas that has the word "overhaul" attached. This will be a lollypop, not a new car (although probably a very tasty and skilfully crafted lollypop). 

Probably best to look at RoverDudes past work as an indicator of what it might be, what things are in his wheelhouse. I think people looking at heat references, or landing references are probably on the right track.

> 
> What can it be!?!?!?!?!?!?!?
> Clamshell fairings, anyone?

Kerosene joke? Maybe better ISRU or more resources?

> 
> Kerosene joke? Maybe better ISRU or more resources?

I think that was a joke about the community, not the featurette.

> 
> It's a small thing - but super cool,

Cool...

Cryogenic fuel for the NERVA with special tanks?

Wow, this is amusing to watch people wracking their brains looking for more clues than are there... Roverdude, wait longer to say it! Or better yet, give more hints hidden inside other misinformation! This is fun to watch! Call the conspiracy theorists!
I'll put my guess in for this..perhaps landing lights on the runway?

> 
> I definitely think its landing approximation because if it were some kind of heat improvement, he probably would not have spent a ton of time playtesting it.

Yes because it went so well last time they didn't extensively playtest all aspects of the new heat system...

And guys, the term featurette is appropriate. This is not some massive thing - it's just something small but really nice that I was able to get into 1.0.3, and I think folks will like. So please set expectations accordingly... so something Larger than a new Xenon tank or SRB, but smaller than asteroid mining.

Nothing to see in the OP, folks. Move along. Just more of the usual, "we're working on something cool, but we can't tell you." Just don't bloody mention it at all then. (insert derisive invective here)

My guess is a landing radar readout that tells you the surface contour below you before you touch down. It makes sense as he mentions landing and as he has built scanners (for finding minerals) before it would be along his line of talents. Personally I think this would be really handy to warn you of landing in a slope before you do.....
